Do you have a full stack of the ConcurrentModificationException itself, 
so it's clear what data structure is throwing the exception? (It should 
be in the _out.log coincident in time with the reports in the job.log.)

This latest NegativeArraySizeException appears to be a problem in some 
third-party code... but because it throws an exception caught outside 
all processing-chains, might be interfering with (or revealing a bug in) 
the intended 'atomicity' of DispositionProcessing with regard to 
checkpointing.

- Gordon @ IA

On 8/19/10 6:48 AM, Kristinn Sigurï¿½sson wrote:
>
>
>> Checkpoints should be much faster in H3 -- and definitely not trigger any
>> ConcurrentModificationExceptions. If you can dig up representative deeper
>> stacks from the exceptions in the _out.log, and attach to a new issue,
> I'll
>> try to figure out what might have happened.
>
> Unfortunately I couldn't find any other exceptions or stack traces that
> might in
> any way explain this.
>
> Another crawl has run into what seems to be the same problem. Again I find
> that it corresponds exactly with a checkpoint event and this time I did
> spot the following in heritrix_out.log from around that time:
>
> 2010-08-19 03:05:10.120 SEVERE thread-84
> org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.recoverableProblem() Problem
> java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException occured when trying to process
> 'http://www.spaug.is/images/dcsflashgames/Air_War.swf?pn_extravars=task~stor
> eScore&pn_modvar=option&pn_modvalue=com_dcs_flashgames&pn_uname=&pn_gid=110&
> pn_domain=http:&pn_license=&pn_checksum=4ad514bbcf3f985ca41965323d764fd5' at
> step ABOUT_TO_BEGIN_PROCESSOR in
>
> java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException
>          at com.anotherbigidea.io.InStream.read(InStream.java:164)
>          at
> org.archive.modules.extractor.ExtractorSWF$ExtractorSWFReader.readOneTag(Ext
> ractorSWF.java:151)
>          at
> com.anotherbigidea.flash.readers.SWFReader.readTags(SWFReader.java:102)
>          at
> com.anotherbigidea.flash.readers.SWFReader.readFile(SWFReader.java:92)
>          at
> org.archive.modules.extractor.ExtractorSWF.innerExtract(ExtractorSWF.java:10
> 1)
>          at
> org.archive.modules.extractor.ContentExtractor.extract(ContentExtractor.java
> :36)
>          at
> org.archive.modules.extractor.Extractor.innerProcess(Extractor.java:95)
>          at
> org.archive.modules.Processor.innerProcessResult(Processor.java:177)
>          at org.archive.modules.Processor.process(Processor.java:144)
>          at
> org.archive.modules.ProcessorChain.process(ProcessorChain.java:131)
>          at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:146)
> not politeness-calc
>
> I'm not really sure if this has anything to do with anything, and I've
> observed the same error having occurred at least one time earlier in the
> crawl without having this effect.
>
> For now I'm not trusting the checkpoint facility :(
>
> - Kris
>
